file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 36-11-11-07 - BLEED-AIR SERVO LINE - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BLEED-AIR SERVO LINE - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the bleed-air servo line duct. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BLEED-AIR DAMPER - CLEANING BY AIR ALL 36-11-11-100-801-A BLAST METHOD BLEED-AIR DAMPER - CLEANING BY UL- ALL 36-11-11-100-802-A TRASONIC METHOD BLEED-AIR RESTRICTOR - CLEANING BY ALL 36-11-11-100-803-A AIR BLAST METHOD BLEED-AIR RESTRICTOR - CLEANING BY ALL 36-11-11-100-804-A ULTRASONIC METHOD EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 36-11-11 Page 1 of 23 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-11-11-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BLEED-AIR DAMPER - CLEANING BY AIR BLAST METHOD A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the bleed-air damper, by air blast method. (2) The damper is installed in the baggage compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200 STATIC GROUNDING - STANDARD PRACTICES AMM TASK 36-00-00-700-803-A/500 AIR BLEED SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST BLEED-AIR DAMPER - CLEANING BY ULTRASONIC AMM TASK 36-11-11-100-802-A/700 METHOD BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - RE- AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400 MOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - IN- AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400 STALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION RH floor panel of the baggage compart- 271 271AF ment LH floor panel of the baggage compart- 272 272AF ment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Goggles For eye protection 1 available Commercially Gloves For hand protection 1 available Source of dry and filtered compressed Locally available To blow dry air into the component 1 air or nitrogen F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 36-11-11 Page 2 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Inside the baggage compartment I. Preparation (Figure 701) SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Keep the aircraft grounded ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (2) Remove access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400). WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS, BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED-AIR TEMPERATURE. (3) Remove the bleed-air damper (2) from the fan-air control thermostat (1) and from the tube (3). J. Cleaning of Bleed-Air Damper by Air Blast Method SUBTASK 170-002-A WARNING: USE EYE AND HAND PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE AN AIR SOURCE TO CLEAN. CONTAMINANTS CAN BECOME AIRBORNE AND CAUSE INJURY TO YOUR EYES AND HANDS. CAUTION: THE COMPRESSED AIR MUST BE DRY AND CLEAN AS FOLLOWS: • THE COMPRESSED AIR MUST NOT CONTAIN WATER, OIL, OR RESIDUES OF OIL COMBUSTION. • AS AN ALTERNATIVE, CLEANING MATERIAL, USE ONLY A MATERIAL THAT IS APPROVED BY EMBRAER MATERIALS ENGINEERING AND APPLICABLE TO THE MATERIAL TO BE CLEANED. • TO REMOVE HEAVY CONTAMINANTS, BLOW AIR AT 25-PSI MAXIMUM PRESSURE FROM A REGULATED AIR SOURCE. (1) Apply pressurized dry air or nitrogen, in the two directions, into the interior of the bleed- air damper. (2) Use a backlight to do a check for obstruction inside the bleed-air damper. If necessary, you can clean it by ultrasonic method (AMM TASK 36-11-11-100-802-A/700) or replace it. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the bleed-air damper (2) to the fan-air control thermostat (1) and from the tube (3). (2) Install access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 36-11-11 Page 3 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Do the Operational Test of the Air Bleed System ( AMM TASK 36-00-00-700-803-A/ 500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 36-11-11 Page 4 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Bleed-Air Damper - Cleaning by Air Blast Method Figure 701 A ZONE 171 172 B 1. FAN-AIR CONTROL THERMOSTAT DET. A 3. TUBE 1 2. DAMPER DET. B (TYP.) DET. C ONLY COMPRESSED AIR 1 THERMOSTAT WITH DAMPER EM145AMM360423A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 36-11-11 Page 5 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-11-11-100-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BLEED-AIR DAMPER - CLEANING BY ULTRASONIC METHOD A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the bleed-air damper, by ultrasonic method. (2) The damper is installed in the baggage compartment. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 36-11-06/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200 STATIC GROUNDING - STANDARD PRACTICES AMM TASK 36-00-00-700-803-A/500 AIR BLEED SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - RE- AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION RH floor panel of the baggage compart- 271 271AF ment LH floor panel of the baggage compart- 272 272AF ment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To contain the cleaner liquid and inside the Erlenmeyer flask available component E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Goggles For eye protection 1 available Commercially Gloves For hand protection 1 available Source of dry and filtered compressed Locally available To dry components after cleaning 1 air or nitrogen Commercially to handle the component and as a protection Pair of tweezers (stainless steel) 1 available for the hands EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 6 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Alconox Cleaning Detergent AR MIL-PRF-680 Dry Cleaning Solvent AR ASTM-D-740 M.E.K AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Inside the baggage compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Keep the aircraft grounded ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (2) Remove access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400). WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS, BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED-AIR TEMPERATURE. (3) Remove the bleed-air damper (2) from the fan-air control thermostat (1) and from the tube (3). J. Cleaning of Bleed-Air Damper by Ultrasonic Method (Figure 702) SUBTASK 130-002-A CAUTION: FOR ULTRASONIC CLEANING, OBEY THESE PRECAUTIONS: • AS AN ALTERNATIVE, USE ONLY A SOLVENT THAT IS APPROVED BY EMBRAER MATERIALS ENGINEERING AND APPLICABLE TO THE MATERIAL TO BE CLEANED. • AFTER THE ULTRASONIC CLEANING OF ALL COMPONENTS, REMOVE THEM FROM THE ULTRASONIC TANK AND PUT THEM FULLY INTO THE CLEANING SOLVENT RINSE TANK FOR CLEANING DURING THE NECESSARY TIME. (1) Put the component in an Erlenmeyer flask. (2) Prepare the AlconoxÃÂ® detergent solution and obey the manufacturer instructions. Use the security equipment and accessories. (3) Put this solution into the Erlenmeyer flask in a sufficient quantity (approximately 400 ml for each component). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 7 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Put the Erlenmeyer flask into the tank of the ultrasonic cleaning machine with clean water at room temperature (approx. 25ÃÂ°C (77ÃÂ°F)). (5) Turn on the ultrasonic cleaning machine, and let the component soak for 120 to 180 minutes in ultrasonic cleaning fluid, at room temperature (approx. 25ÃÂ°C (77ÃÂ°F)). (6) After the ultrasonic cleaning, turn off the ultrasonic cleaning machine, and remove the Erlenmeyer flask from it. (7) Rinse the component with clean water for sufficient time for the removal of the residues of AlconoxÃÂ® detergent solution. (8) Put the dry cleaning solvent (MIL-PRF-680) or M.E.K. (ASTM-D-740) into the other clean Erlenmeyer flask in sufficient quantity to cover all the component. (9) Turn on the ultrasonic cleaning machine and let the component soak for 10 to 15 minutes in ultrasonic cleaning fluid, at room temperature (approx. 25ÃÂ°C (77ÃÂ°F)). (10) Dry the component with a hot-air drier or dry compressed air. CAUTION: USE AN APPLICABLE PAIR OF TWEEZERS OR EQUIVALENT TOOL TO HANDLE THE COMPONENT DURING THE DRYING PROCEDURE TO PREVENT THE HOT AIR OF THE DRIER AND HAND BURNING BECAUSE OF THE METALLIC COMPONENT HEATING. (11) If the air does not flow freely through the component, replace it ( AMM MPP 36-11-06/400). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Install the bleed-air damper (2) to the fan-air control thermostat (1) and from the tube (3). (2) Install access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400). (3) Do the Operational Test of the Air Bleed System ( AMM TASK 36-00-00-700-803-A/ 500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 8 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Bleed-Air Damper - Cleaning by Ultrasonic Method Figure 702 - Sheet 1 A ZONE 171 172 B DET. A 1. FAN-AIR CONTROL THERMOSTAT 3. TUBE 1 2. DAMPER DET. B (TYP.) 1 THERMOSTAT WITH DAMPER EM145AMM360425A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 9 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Bleed-Air Damper - Cleaning by Ultrasonic Method Figure 702 - Sheet 2 ERLENMEYER FLASK BLEED-AIR DAMPER DETERGENT SOLUTION WATER NOTE: - PUT THE COMPONENT INTO AN ERLENMEYER FLASK, PUT THE ALCONOXÃÂ® SOLUTION SOLVENT INTO IT IN A SUFFICIENT QUANTITY TO COVER THE COMPONENT, AND THEN PUT THE ERLENMEYER FLASK INTO THE TANK OF THE ULTRASONIC CLEANING MACHINE WITH CLEAN WATER AT ROOM TEMPERATURE. LET THE COMPONENT STAY 120 TO 180 MINUTES IN ULTRASONIC CLEANING. EM145AMM360434C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 10 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Bleed-Air Damper - Cleaning by Ultrasonic Method Figure 702 - Sheet 3 ERLENMEYER BLEED-AIR DAMPER CLEANER LIQUID WATER ULTRASONIC CLEANING DEVICE EM145AMM360435B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 11 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Bleed-Air Damper - Cleaning by Ultrasonic Method Figure 702 - Sheet 4 DETERGENT SOLUTION ERLENMEYER FLASK BLEED-AIR DAMPER NOTE: - DISCARD THE DEGREASING SOLVENT IN THE CORRECT LOCATION THEN, REMOVE THE COMPONENT AND DRY IT WITH A HOT AIR DRIER DURING A FEW MINUTES. CAUTION: USE THE APPLICABLE PAIR OFTWEEZERS TO HANDLE THE COMPONENT DURING THE DRYING PROCEDURE TO PREVENT THE HOT AIR OF THE DRIER AND HAND BURNING BECAUSE OF THE METALLIC COMPONENT HEATING. - DISCARD THE ALCONOXÃÂ® SOLUTION IN THE CORRECT LOCATION THEN RINSE THE COMPONENT WITH CLEAN WATER AT ROOM TEMPERATURE DURING SUFFICIENT TIME FOR REMOVAL OF THE RESIDUES OF ALCONOXÃÂ® SOLUTION SOLVENT. DISCARD THE WATER AND APPLY THE SAME PROCEDURE WITH DEGREASING SOLVENT DURING A FEW MINUTES IN THE ULTRASONIC EQUIPMENT. EM145AMM360436C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-802-A/700 36-11-11 Page 12 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the bleed-air restrictor, by air blast method. (2) The restrictor is installed in the baggage compartment. B. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Inside the baggage compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A (1) Keep the aircraft grounded ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (2) Remove access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400). WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS, BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED-AIR TEMPERATURE. (3) Remove the bleed-air restrictor (2) from the fan-air control thermostat (1) and from the tube (3). J. Cleaning of Bleed-air Restrictor by Air Blast Method (Figure 703) SUBTASK 170-003-A WARNING: USE EYE AND HAND PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE AN AIR SOURCE TO CLEAN. CONTAMINANTS CAN BECOME AIRBORNE AND CAUSE INJURY TO YOUR EYE AND HAND. CAUTION: THE COMPRESSED AIR MUST BE DRY AND CLEAN AS FOLLOWS: • THE COMPRESSED AIR MUST NOT CONTAIN WATER, OIL, OR RESIDUES OF OIL COMBUSTION. • AS AN ALTERNATIVE, CLEANING MATERIAL, USE ONLY A MATERIAL THAT IS APPROVED BY EMBRAER MATERIALS ENGINEERING AND APPLICABLE TO THE MATERIAL TO BE CLEANED. • TO REMOVE HEAVY CONTAMINANTS, BLOW AIR AT 25-PSI MAXIMUM PRESSURE FROM A REGULATED AIR SOURCE. (1) Apply pressurized dry air or nitrogen, in the two directions, into the interior of the bleed- air restrictor. (2) Use a backlight to do a check for obstruction inside the bleed-air restrictor. If necessary, you can clean it by ultrasonic method ( AMM TASK 36-11-11-100-804-A/ 700) or replace it. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-005-A (1) Install the bleed air restrictor (2) to the tube (3) and to the hose that comes from the fan-air control thermostat (1). (2) Install access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-803-A/700 36-11-11 Page 14 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Do the Operational Test of the Air Bleed System ( AMM TASK 36-00-00-700-803-A/ 500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-803-A/700 36-11-11 Page 15 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Alconox Cleaning Detergent AR ASTM D740 Cleaning Solvent AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Inside the baggage compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Keep the aircraft grounded ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (2) Remove access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400). WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS, BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED-AIR TEMPERATURE. (3) Remove the bleed-air restrictor from the fan-air control thermostat ( AMM TASK 36-11-06-000-801-A/400). J. Cleaning of Bleed-Air Restrictor by Ultrasonic Method (Figure 704) SUBTASK 130-003-A CAUTION: FOR ULTRASONIC CLEANING, OBEY THESE PRECAUTIONS: • AS AN ALTERNATIVE, USE ONLY A SOLVENT THAT IS APPROVED BY EMBRAER MATERIALS ENGINEERING AND APPLICABLE TO THE MATERIAL TO BE CLEANED. • AFTER THE ULTRASONIC CLEANING OF ALL COMPONENTS, REMOVE THEM FROM THE ULTRASONIC CLEANER MACHINE AND PUT THEM FULLY INTO THE CLEANER SOLVENT RINSE TANK FOR CLEANING DURING THE NECESSARY TIME. (1) Put the component in an Erlenmeyer flask. (2) Prepare the AlconoxÃÂ® detergent solution and obey the manufacturer instructions. Use the security equipment and accessories. (3) Put this solution into the Erlenmeyer flask in a sufficient quantity (approximately 400 ml for each component). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-804-A/700 36-11-11 Page 18 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Put the Erlenmeyer flask in the tank of the ultrasonic cleaning machine with clean water at room temperature ( (approx. 25ÃÂ°C (77ÃÂ°F)). (5) Turn on the ultrasonic cleaning machine, and let the component soak for 120 to 180 minutes in ultrasonic cleaning fluid, at room temperature (approx. 25ÃÂ°C (77ÃÂ°F)). (6) After the ultrasonic cleaning, turn off the ultrasonic cleaning machine, and remove the Erlenmeyer flask from it. (7) Rinse the component with clean water for sufficient time for removal of the residues of AlconoxÃÂ® detergent solution. (8) Put the degreasing solvent (MEK) into the other clean Erlenmeyer flask in sufficient quantity to cover all the component. (9) Turn on the ultrasonic cleaning machine, and let the component soak for 10 to 15 minutes in ultrasonic cleaning fluid, at room temperature (approx. 25ÃÂ°C (77ÃÂ°F)). (10) Dry the component with a hot-air drier or dry compressed air. CAUTION: USE AN APPLICABLE PAIR OF TWEEZERS OR EQUIVALENT TOOL TO HANDLE THE COMPONENT DURING THE DRYING PROCEDURE TO PREVENT THE HOT AIR OF THE DRIER AND HAND BURNING BECAUSE OF THE METALLIC COMPONENT HEATING. (11) If the air does not flow freely through the component, replace it ( AMM MPP 36-11-06/400). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-004-A (1) Install the bleed air restrictor (2) to the tube (3) and to the hose that comes from the fan-air control thermostat (1). (2) Install access panels 271AF and 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400). (3) Do the Operational Test of the Air Bleed System ( AMM TASK 36-00-00-700-803-A/ 500). LET THE COMPONENT STAY 120 TO 180 MINUTES IN ULTRASONIC CLEANING. EM145AMM360428D.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-804-A/700 36-11-11 Page 21 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Bleed-Air Restrictor - Cleaning by Ultrasonic Method Figure 704 - Sheet 4 DETERGENT SOLUTION ERLENMEYER FLASK BLEED-AIR RESTRICTOR NOTE: - DISCARD THE DEGREASING SOLVENT IN THE CORRECT LOCATION THEN, REMOVE THE COMPONENT AND DRY IT WITH A HOT AIR DRIER DURING A FEW MINUTES. CAUTION: USE THE APPLICABLE PAIR OFTWEEZERS TO HANDLE THE COMPONENT DURING THE DRYING PROCEDURE TO PREVENT THE HOT AIR OF THE DRIER AND HAND BURNING BECAUSE OF THE METALLIC COMPONENT HEATING. - DISCARD THE ALCONOXÃÂ® SOLUTION IN THE CORRECT LOCATION THEN RINSE THE COMPONENT WITH CLEAN WATER AT ROOM TEMPERATURE DURING SUFFICIENT TIME FOR REMOVAL OF THE RESIDUES OF ALCONOXÃÂ® SOLUTION SOLVENT. DISCARD THE WATER AND APPLY THE SAME PROCEDURE WITH DEGREASING SOLVENT DURING A FEW MINUTES IN THE ULTRASONIC EQUIPMENT. EM145AMM360430E.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-804-A/700 36-11-11 Page 23 of 23 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
